page.title: 11THE BELL PUB. PURLEIGH HILL
page.content: The{Bell}Public House stands at the top of Purleigh Hill.Mr Cook has been the landlord since 1973.He doesn't mind living next to the church.The earliest part of the building is the kitchen which was built about 1370.A licence to sell beer was granted in 1670.The Bell is an Ind Coope House,and opening hours are 10.00am until 2.30pm; and 6.00 until 11.00pm. The snack bar is open from 12.00am until 2.00pm;and they sell Scampi,Plaice,Ham,Chicken or sausages with chips. Mr Cook enjoys his work,his busiest days are Friday,Saturday and Sunday.He does his shopping in Maldon on Tuesdays or at ASDA in Woodham Ferrers on Fridays.He gets his drinks from Chelmsford.
